meanings.definition: To make very tired or weary.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the long walk home overwearies me.
meanings.sent2: The intense workout overwearies my muscles, but it's worth it.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those heavy books overwearies my poor backpack!
meanings.sent4: The never-ending meetings overwearied her spirit, draining her enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The challenging puzzle overwearied my brain, leaving me in need of a break.

meanings.sent1: The marathon overwearies even the most seasoned runners.
meanings.sent2: Staying up all night studying overwearies students before exams.
meanings.sent3: The constant barking of the neighbor's dog overwearies our patience.
meanings.sent4: The demanding job overwearied him to the point of seeking a new career.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending chores overwearied her, making her dream of a vacation.
